summary: An ultramarathon is a running race longer than a regular marathon (26 miles). Ultra running includes various distances, from 31 miles up to 3,100 miles, on different surfaces and formats. Some races are completed in under 24 hours, while others span multiple days. The oldest and largest ultramarathons are often road races, like the Comrades Marathon with over 10,000 finishers yearly. There are world championships for different ultra distances, and some races have historical significance, like the Spartathlon, inspired by an ancient Greek messenger's run.
title: Ultramarathon
